question: The Keibul Lamjao National Park is located in which state?
explanation: The Keibul Lamjao National Park is the only floating park in the world, located in the Bishnupur district of Manipur. It is an integral part of Loktak Lake, which is famous for the phumdis floating over it. The park is home to brow-antlered deer \'Sangai\' that has been included in the Centre-sponsored endangered species recovery programme. Apart from the brow-antlered deer, the other mammals  reported are the hog deer, wild boar, , large Indian civet, common otter,  jungle cat, golden cat, bay bamboo rat, musk shrew, etc.
